title.rendered: A Hygiene Workshop conducted at Nilgiri Hills Public School

content.rendered:
Recently, a workshop was conducted in collaboration with the Child for Child (CFC) program by Smile Foundation at Nilgiri Hills Public School in Noida, led by Ms. Shaiqa Tabassum, a dedicated trainer. This session was designed to educate over 700 children on a spectrum of vital hygiene aspects.

The workshop emphasized oral hygiene, stressing the importance of proper dental care. It explained the significance of personal cleanliness in bathing rituals and highlighted the need for daily hygiene practices to maintain a healthy lifestyle. Children were also educated on keeping their living spaces clean and hygienic, fostering a safe environment. Furthermore, the session encouraged responsible behavior in maintaining a clean and healthy environment for all and addressed the significance of mental well-being and emotional hygiene.

This collaborative effort with the CFC program reflects Smile Foundation’s commitment to empowering these young minds to adopt healthier practices and become champions of good hygiene, ensuring a brighter future for them.
